meanings.definition: To send on or forward again.
meanings.sent1: She reconsigned the package to the correct address.
meanings.sent2: The company reconsigned the shipment for faster delivery.
meanings.sent3: He reconsigned the letter, hoping it would reach its destination this time.
meanings.sent4: The email was reconsigned to the spam folder, never to be seen again.
meanings.sent5: The lost parcel was reconsigned to the courier for a second attempt at delivery.

meanings.definition: To assign or transfer to another person or place for further action.
meanings.sent1: The manager reconsigned the task to a more experienced employee.
meanings.sent2: They reconsigned the project to a different department for completion.
meanings.sent3: She reconsigned the responsibility, relieved to pass it on.
meanings.sent4: The decision was reconsigned to the committee for further discussion.
meanings.sent5: He reconsigned the duty, knowing it was in capable hands now.
